item.title: Comcastâ€™s 100 Gbps Core Network Supports Business
item.description:
Over the past year, major telecom companies have been upgrading their core networks from 40 Gbps to 100 Gbps. Comcast recently joined this trend by incorporating Ciena’s Wave Logic 3 interfaces into their existing Ciena 6500 packet optical platforms. This begs the question: why would a cable company make this change, and how can it benefit your business? Comcast is widely recognized as a Cable TV provider, or MSO (Multi-System Operator)...

item.title: The Samsung Epic 4G offers Epic Performance
item.description:
Imagine a smartphone so powerful it surpasses a netbook. Picture yourself declining WiFi because your cellular connection is faster. That’s the kind of speed the Samsung Epic 4G offers with its impressive 10+ Mbps download speeds, thanks to the Sprint WiMAX 4G network. You can even share your connection as a mobile hotspot for your other devices. Beyond speed, the Epic boasts a stunning Super AMOLED touchscreen display with near-HD quality and unmatched contrast...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-samsung-epic-4g-offers-epic-performance/

item.title: Time to Move to HD Video Cameras
item.description:
The familiar sound of “Taps” softly playing from your TV symbolizes the end of an era: analog television. From its start with Herbert Hoover to its abrupt conclusion, marked by TV stations switching off their analog transmitters, this technology has reached its end. The outdated 4:3 video format should disappear alongside it, but strangely, it’s still present. Observe TV broadcasts throughout the day, and you’ll find many programs, including network shows and local news, still framed by black bars on the sides...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/time-to-move-to-hd-video-cameras/
